meanings.definition: To weep more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outweep her sister when they watch sad movies together.
meanings.sent2: The little girl managed to outweep all her classmates at the school play.
meanings.sent3: During the crying contest, he attempted to outweep the judges, but they were not impressed.
meanings.sent4: Her tears seemed to outweep the rain pouring down outside.
meanings.sent5: The grieving widow's sobs could outweep the howling wind on a stormy night.

meanings.sent1: In the competition, she aimed to outweep her opponent by shedding more tears.
meanings.sent2: He always manages to outweep his friends whenever they watch emotional movies together.
meanings.sent3: The baby tried to outweep his mother, but she just laughed at his attempts.
meanings.sent4: Her sorrow was so deep that it could outweep the ocean's waves crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes could outweep a storm cloud, always brimming with tears.
